title: Intermittent Fasting (IF)
summary: Structured eating windows (e.g., 14:10, 16:8) can reduce total energy intake and improve some metabolic markers for appropriate individuals.

evidence.title: Weight & Metabolic Markers
evidence.summary: IF and continuous calorie restriction have broadly similar effects on weight; some studies show improved insulin sensitivity.
evidence.citation: Hoddy et al. Annu Rev Nutr 2020; Varady et al. Cell Metab 2018.

evidence.title: Early Time-Restricted Eating
evidence.summary: Aligning eating earlier with circadian rhythm may improve glycemic control in some.
evidence.citation: Sutton et al. Cell Metab 2018; Lowe et al. JAMA Intern Med 2020.

safety: Not for children, pregnancy, eating disorders, or underweight.
Watch for headaches, low energy initially.
banm_applications: Start with 12:12, progress to 14:10 if appropriate.
Focus on nutrient-dense meals during the eating window; hydrate well.

authenticity.issue: Hype vs. adherence reality; protocols vary widely.
authenticity.recommendation: Personalize to lifestyle, meds, training load; monitor response.
